question: I'm trying to understand the basics - can you explain what life insurance actually is?
What's the difference between term and permanent coverage?
My employer offers group life insurance. Is that enough or should I get my own policy too?
How do I figure out how much coverage I actually need for my family?
Do I have to take a medical exam to apply, or are there options without one?
I'm a smoker - can I still get coverage and how much more will it cost me?
Can you tell me what whole life insurance is and how it works?
If I have a pre-existing health condition, will I be able to get insured?
What happens to my policy if I can't afford to pay the premium one month?
I heard I can borrow money from my policy - is that true and how does it work?
How long does it usually take for my family to receive the payout after I pass away?
Will my beneficiaries have to pay taxes on the death benefit?
What's the deal with riders? Are they worth the extra cost?
Can I change who receives my death benefit after I've already set up the policy?
I want to get life insurance for my kids - is that possible?
What information do I need to have ready when I apply for coverage?
If I'm diagnosed with a terminal illness, can I access my death benefit early?
My term policy is about to expire - what are my options?
How often should I review my coverage to make sure it still fits my needs?
What's universal life insurance and how is it different from whole life?
Can my business buy life insurance on key employees?
I missed some payments and my policy lapsed - can I get it back?
What factors determine how much my premium will be?
Is there a time limit where the insurance company can deny my claim for misstatements on my application?
If I decide this policy isn't right for me after I buy it, can I cancel and get my money back?
